alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 10:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Above Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Most of the camping areas and roadways in Burnside Lake Water Park are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Monday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...With heavy rainfall in the forecast, the river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Pearl River Philadelphi 13.0 13.2 Mon 8 am CDT 13.0 13.8 15.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 9 PM CDT.
